subject: junit4: Exceptions in TestListener
msgSnippet: I m trying to implement a custom TestListener in JUnit 4. These methods do I/O. They tend to look like this: public void testRunStarted(int testCount) { try {
messageBody:
I'm trying to implement a custom TestListener in JUnit 4. These methods
do I/O. They tend to look like this:

public void testRunStarted(int testCount) {
try {
out.write("<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>\r\n");
}
catch (IOException ex) {
throw new RuntimeException(ex);
}
}

Should the TestListener interfaces be declared to throw Exception or
some kind of JUnitException so one doesn't have to wrap everything in a
RuntimeException?



--
